chapter.title: To make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him

para.emphasis: Do not be afraid, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard.

chapter.para: John the Baptist was to be the last prophet according to the Old Testament pattern. He came as prophesied in Malachi 4:5 and other places in the Old Testament in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers back to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just.

John was coming to a people who knew the Bible better than any of their forefathers. They had large parts of their Bible memorized. Some had memorized the whole thing. They had analyzed tiny details of the Bible's grammar in its original language for its minute flavors of meaning. They were very zealous for the traditions that had been handed down to them.

When the wise men came looking for Jesus, following the star, none of Bible scholars of the day could be bothered to follow up on the wise mens' report that their Messiah had been born, even though they knew from the Scriptures where he would be found. Although all of the signs that their Messiah was about to come had already been fulfilled, most had stopped watching and waiting for his appearing.
Except for a tiny minority (Simeon, Anna), they didn't know how to hear God's voice.
They had replaced relationship with human knowledge and religious ritual.

sect1.title: To prepare the way of the Lord
sect1.para: This situation was a great difficulty for the people of Israel. They knew about God, but they didn't know him. But Jesus, their Messiah was about to come, and how would they recognize God in human form if they didn't know God to begin with?

sect1.title: Zechariah's obedience
sect1.para: Zechariah was priest to God in the middle of this culture. Unlike most in his culture, he still believed--in his mind at least--that God could still speak and could still work miracles. And he was praying for a miracle: a son, even though he and his wife were too old to have children.
Zechariah had entered the temple to burn incense. Revelation 5:8 and 8:3-4 identify incense as a symbol of the prayers of God's people.
Zechariah had entered the temple to pray instead of another priest because the Lord had revealed for him to do so through casting lots according to the custom of the priesthood (v8).
So Zechariah was praying in the Temple, in God's presence. He was praying at a time God had revealed--when God spoke through casting lots that he wanted Zechariah to come near and pray.

And Zechariah was about to find out, in the most dramatic way possible, that he had been praying in God's will. Because God had sent an angel to meet Zechariah in that place and to deliver the message of God's promise of an answer.

sect1.title: The answer
sect1.para: The answer that God had promised was far beyond what Zechariah had asked.

Zechariah had just asked for a child. And God had provided much more than any child. God promised a son who would carry Israel's spiritual inheritance forward. Who would turn Israel's hearts back to a relationship with God. They needed to be prepared because they were living in the time just before Jesus, Immanuel, God With Us was about to come.
Naturally, the Lord was concerned with the material blessing. A flesh-and-blood son would carry forward Zechariah's family inheritance and take away his social stigma from being childless.

But the Lord was far more concerned with who this son would be spiritually. What he would do. How he would live. What his life would mean. What spiritual inheritance, what spiritual legacy he would leave.

sect1.title: Forerunner before the Lord
sect1.para: John's spiritual legacy was to be the forerunner before Jesus, to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him..
They needed their hearts prepared so that when Jesus came, as many as possible would be ready to believe him, to receive his word, and to follow him. This has several components:

para.emphasis: He will turn many of the people of Israel to the Lord their God.

sect1.para: To be turned to God first requires that our affections be turned away from all other things. For example, they needed to no longer have the following sorts of things rule their affections::

listitem.para: Amusements and worldly pleasure as a primary goal in their lives
Religious works motivated from a desire to please one's self
Philosophy, including theology, as an end in itself

sect1.para: To be turned to God means to have one's focus, attention, and desire fixed on God above all of these other things. To change one's prioirites foremost to a passionate love pursuit of God.
The person who could accomplish these tasks needed some special qualifications:

listitem.para: To be great in the sight of the Lord (as opposed to the sight of man)
To avoid wine or strong drink. In this context, wine is a symbol of this world's pleasures.
To be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from (before) their spiritual birth

sect1.para: The name John means the grace or mercy of the Lord -- this is the only way our hearts can be turned back to the Lord.

This was John's function: to proclaim God's grace and mercy. To invite people out of a system of theology, head knowledge, and works and back into a relationship with God through the one who would follow--that is, though Jesus.

The only thing required of people was for them to repent, to tell God they were sorry for trying to live life by themselves according to ideas, rules, and regulations. Instead, they simply needed to receive God's free love, grace, and forgiveness begin to choose a love relationship with him.

sect1.title: This was an (humanly) impossible task
sect1.para: This was an impossible task, both for Zechariah and for John.
Zechariah had aged, both physically and spiritually.

Physically, he and his wife were too old to have children. And spiritually, although his mind still believed in a living God who hears his people and works miracles, his heart had stopped believing. Both of these difficulties needed addressing, and humanly speaking, both are impossible to address.
But what is impossible for man is possible for God.
God was about to do two miracles for Zechariah:

listitem.para: To give Zechariah a physical son.
To change Zechariah's heart from a spiritually aged heart of unbelief to a fresh, young, vibrant heart of faith, full of the Holy Spirit.

sect1.para: And through Zechariah, God was going to birth one who would:

listitem.para: Be great in the sight of the Lord (as opposed to the sight of man)
Not drink the wine of this world's pleasures
Be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from (before) birth
Continue the task of turning many more of God's chosen people to the Lord their God
Go as forerunner before the Lord...to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him

sect1.title: The Church has a similar function
sect1.para: Today, we live in a similar spiritual situation.

The dominant Christian culture elevates Bible teachers who are trained in a certain way above all of the people. These teachers memorize large parts of the Bible and study the minute details of the original language for its shades of meaning.
A result is that people have a lot of head knowledge about God, but few know God in a love relationship. Only a love relationship with God is a proper motive to study the Bible that way.
And today, the Lord still wants to raise up a people with a prophetic function: to to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him. Because Jesus is coming again.
The first time, Jesus came as the lamb to be slain. Next time He will come as the Lion of Judah, the conquering king.

sect1.title: Your prayer has been heard
sect1.para: Today, we live near the end of church history. The institutional Western church has aged and is no longer producing spiritual children able to transform our culture. Institutional church attendance in the decline and peoples' hearts are growing progressively colder.
But Jesus is coming. And the Lord has called to himself a people prepared for him.
We too have an impossible task: Like Zechariah, the Lord has called us to bear these spiritual children. Spiritual children who, like John the Baptist:

listitem.para: Will be great in the sight of the Lord (as opposed to the sight of man)
Will not drink the wine of this world's pleasures
Will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from (before) their spiritual birth
Will continue the task of turning many more of God's chosen people to the Lord their God
Will go as forerunner before the Lord...to make ready for the Lord a people prepared for him

sect1.para: Similar to Zechariah, we cannot do this task in our own ability.
Just like Zechariah, we can only pray that God would give us these children.

And like Zechariah, the Lord sends his angel to announce that our prayers are according to God's will. That these prayers are heard. And that as we are faithful, the Lord will provide, just as he said.

para.emphasis: Do not be afraid, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard.
